intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I hope the others escaped...

intro.speaker: Laura
intro.line: I'm sure they are safe and secure, just as I'm sure the abbot got his medicine. I believe in them.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Pardon... Excuse me. Not to pry, but did you know you're bleeding? You've got some blood on your sleeve there.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Hm? Oh, you're right! I've been so distracted, I didn't even notice...

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Unfortunately, there are no vulneraries to heal you in this rat hole... Here, try wrapping this cloth around your wound.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Thank you very much. I don't believe we've met. I'm Micaiah.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: I'm Aimee. I've been a lucky guest in this dungeon for quite some time. On behalf of myself and my snoozing friend over there, Ilyana, it's very nice to meet you, Micaiah.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Why are you two in here?

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: I wish I knew! I belong to a merchant caravan that was passing through en route to the next market day. When we arrived here, we were brought to this charming prison against our will. Now, we await "the general's pleasure."

intro.speaker: Laura
intro.line: I see. Well, that doesn't sound good. How unfortunate.
Um...

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: So you can talk. You've been so quiet over there, I assumed you didn't speak our language.
...if you wish, you may use this salve on your wound. It's an infusion of olivi grass.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Olivi grass? Hm, I've never heard of it. Are you sure it's safe?
It's unquestionably safe...and effective.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Thank you most kindly. I'll try it.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Well, aren't you the trusting one? Are you honestly comfortable applying a strange medicine to your wound?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I am. I know it will work. Thank you for sharing your medicine.
You're welcome!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I hear something!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Here you are.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Yune! I'm so glad you're both all right!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Sorry it took so long to get here. Hello.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Well, hello! I remember you. You've certainly grown up to be easy on the eyes! I believe I'm a little smitten.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: You two know each other?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Somewhat. We crossed paths during the war. Let's get out of here before the guards come. I'll open the door, then we'll find a way out.
I would like to get out of here, too. Like Aimee, I have no idea why I've been imprisoned. May I join you?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: By all means!
I thank you much. My name is Kurth.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Well then, Kurth, after you.

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: Sothe, this way!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Nolan! Edward! Leonardo! It's so good to see you all.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: How did you manage to sneak in this far without my help?

intro.speaker: Nolan
intro.line: Oddly, one of the soldiers let us in the back way.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: A Begnion soldier?

intro.speaker: Edward
intro.line: Yes, he said, "If you're here to save Laura, follow me."

intro.speaker: Laura
intro.line: How strange. Why would a Begnion soldier mention me?

intro.speaker: Mercenary
intro.line: The prisoners are escaping!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Surprise, surprise! They found us!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Micaiah, this is for you.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: My tome! How did you get it?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I didn't know if it was yours, but I figured you could use it. So at the armory, I "borrowed" it too.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Well done, Sothe. Now I can pull my weight and fight.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: And a staff for you, Sister.

intro.speaker: Leonardo
intro.line: Thank you very much.

intro.speaker: Ilyana
intro.line: Um... I... I can fight too. Could you...lend me that tome?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: What, you mean this one? Ilyana, I didn't know you used light magic, too.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe, that's a tome of lightning magic.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: It is?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I give up. You just grabbed at random, didn't you?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: You know I can't read the old language. The letters all look the same to me! Here. If this one will work, take it. Just like old times, right, Ilyana?

intro.speaker: Ilyana
intro.line: Thank you... And yes, Sothe... I don't want to fight...but I'm glad I'll get to fight alongside you again...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Ilyana? If you're not up to it, don't feel pressured to fight. We can handle the soldiers. You look a little woozy. Are you sure you're going to be all right?

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: She's fine, Micaiah. She's always like that.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Ilyana
intro.line: I can fight... I'm...very angry... The food here... It was terrible, and...they gave us hardly any... I...will have vengeance.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: This girl takes her food pretty seriously. Interesting.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I see Ilyana is as hungry as ever.

intro.speaker: Aimee
intro.line: Don't worry about us. We'll carefully tiptoe around you all. The boy and I can't fight, so we'll stay out of harm's way. Good luck, everyone!

intro.speaker: Kurth
intro.line: I am sorry to impose upon you. Please be careful.

recruit-talk.speaker: Laura
recruit-talk.line: Aran? I can't believe it! It IS you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Laura
recruit-talk.line: I knew it! But, Aran, why? Why would any true Daein join sides with Begnion?

recruit-talk.speaker: Aran
recruit-talk.line: A true Daein? I'm not sure I still am one... Not since a family of merchants from Begnion took me in... But I could never do anything to hurt you. You've always been like a little sister to me. Get out of here, Laura ...while you still have a chance! I'll turn a blind eye.

recruit-talk.speaker: Laura
recruit-talk.line: But what about Micaiah and Sothe? They've risked their lives fighting for the abbot--and for me. I couldn't possibly abandon them now, not even if it meant saving myself.

recruit-talk.speaker: Aran
recruit-talk.line: I can't keep lying to myself any longer. I know what Begnion is doing in Daein is despicable, and I can't support it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Aran
recruit-talk.line: Then...from now on, I'm fighting for what's right...just like the abbot taught us. Come on. Let's get you--and everyone else--out of here!

recruit-talk.speaker: Laura
recruit-talk.line: Wonderful! Thank you, Aran. I knew it. You haven't changed a bit. You're as considerate as ever. Your family would have been so proud!

boss.speaker: Burton
boss.line: Ehhhh! You won't get away! I'll slice through you like a hot knife through cold butter!

boss.speaker: Burton
boss.line: Even if you run... There is no place...for you scum...to go...

boss.speaker: Burton
boss.line: You! Crawl quietly back to your cell, and I'll spare you. More than that, however, I cannot promise.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: Don't be so sure. This isn't our first fight, and it won't be our last.

boss.speaker: Burton
boss.line: A brave, yet foolish, sentiment. Before the might of the empire, you lowlifes are just cracked dirt beneath my boots!!

end.speaker: Aimee
end.line: Thank you so much...all of you! Because of your bravery, I can finally rejoin my merchant caravan. Still, coming back to Nevassa, I'm stunned at the terrible state of things. Who would have thought that Begnion would rule with such an iron fist? They run your nation with boundless cruelty, looting the towns and sending your able-bodied men to camps. It breaks my heart.

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: They make me miss Ashnard, Daein's late "Mad King." And I never thought I'd say that! At least he never tried to destroy Crimea as a country!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What do you mean by that?

end.speaker: Daniel
end.line: People make a country. One person--even a noble king--does not a country make. And a strong country only exists when its people are strong. As Begnion crushes the citizenry, it slowly destroys Daein.

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: The dastards are treating Daein like a nation of slaves! If this persists, Daein's strength will be sapped, and the nation itself will cease to be.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Then, what should we do? What can we do to save our country?

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: There is a rumor. If it's true, there might be hope...

end.speaker: Muston
end.line: Look here, Jorge! Don't go spouting off rumors.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: No, I want to know! If there is a shred of hope for us, tell me.

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: Well, the rumor is that King Ashnard left an orphan behind.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Really? Is that true?!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: King Ashnard had a child? Why have I never heard of this?

end.speaker: Daniel
end.line: It's just a rumor--nothing more. But if it's true, it would be a strike of great fortune for Daein.

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: In the last war, Crimea used a scion of the royal family to unify its people and rally a liberation army. So could Daein.

end.speaker: Aimee
end.line: And drive out the loathsome Begnion!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: So where is this orphan?

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: According to rumor, he's in the east, near the Desert of Death, trying to raise an army to lay claim to the throne. Shall we go there?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah, what do you think?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...In the desert...an important encounter awaits us. It shall be one that changes the shape of our future.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Well, that's it then. We must go to the desert to meet our destiny.
